pullRequest.body:
This prepares for the introduction of a non-dependent synonym of FunLike, which helps a lot with keeping #8386 readable.

This is entirely search-and-replace in [680197f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9785/commits/680197facd83904c603e7b8bc2eecbd9eeaf0787) combined with manual fixes in [4145626](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9785/commits/414562627a8d287559068ff02cc811c262a1d6c8), [e900597](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9785/commits/e900597f6895dd14d4a60dcf83b596965717c35d) and [b8428f8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9785/commits/b8428f88f3e07f9be6b673266af8b0795bb3427d). The commands that generated this change:
```bash
sed -i 's/\bFunLike\b/DFunLike/g' {Archive,Counterexamples,Mathlib,test}/**/*.lean
sed -i 's/\btoFunLike\b/toDFunLike/g' {Archive,Counterexamples,Mathlib,test}/**/*.lean
sed -i 's/import Mathlib.Data.DFunLike/import Mathlib.Data.FunLike/g' {Archive,Counterexamples,Mathlib,test}/**/*.lean
sed -i 's/\bHom_FunLike\b/Hom_DFunLike/g' {Archive,Counterexamples,Mathlib,test}/**/*.lean     
sed -i 's/\binstFunLike\b/instDFunLike/g' {Archive,Counterexamples,Mathlib,test}/**/*.lean
sed -i 's/\bfunLike\b/instDFunLike/g' {Archive,Counterexamples,Mathlib,test}/**/*.lean
sed -i 's/\btoo many metavariables to apply `fun_like.has_coe_to_fun`/too many metavariables to apply `DFunLike.hasCoeToFun`/g' {Archive,Counterexamples,Mathlib,test}/**/*.lean
```

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: I decided to rename all the `instance funLike` to `instance instDFunLike` to make the naming convention consistent all at once. If you disagree, it should be easy to revert and redo [e5798c5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9785/commits/e5798c5ab98a41ee8cdf6b2dba5267d4591b8a43).

I think this has had a thorough look-over. I am going to delegate it. 

If anyone has any more comments, please register them soon. 

bors-delegate+

Human error. 

bors delegate+

:v: Vierkantor can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Build passed! I'll merge in a couple hours unless there are any further comments.

I see no objection and no changes relating to `FunLike` on the master branch, so let's try and get this merged!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7563029205/job/20594649264)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7563029205/job/20594648660)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7563029205/job/20594649413)

I manually looked through the diff and didn't see any howlers. I guess the main thing I learnt is that we are very inconsistent with `instFunLike` v `funLike` for instance names. I guess the instance names might also all be changeable with `sed`.
Quick pass through visible changes in GH UI. Only some naming conventions.
Quick pass through visible changes in GH UI. Only some naming conventions.

I manually looked through the diff and didn't see any howlers. I guess the main thing I learnt is that we are very inconsistent with `instFunLike` v `funLike` for instance names. I guess the instance names might also all be changeable with `sed`.

```suggestion
instance Hom_DFunLike (X Y : CommMonCat) : DFunLike (X  Y) X (fun _ => Y) :=
```

```suggestion
instance instDFunLike { : R +* S} : DFunLike (M [] M) M ( _  M) :=
```
Do you think editing this porting note is OK?

Not sure: it would be false as written so probably revert this? Although I suppose the error would involve `DFunLike` if we ported now, so maybe it's okay. Probably we can delete this instance anyway (after #8386). 

```suggestion
/- Porting note: Lean gave me `unknown constant 'FunLike.CoeFun'` and says `CoeFun` is a type
```

```suggestion
instance instDFunLike (X Y : SemiNormedGroupCat) : DFunLike (X  Y) X (fun _ => Y) where
```

```suggestion
def ConcreteCategory.dfunLike {X Y : C} : DFunLike (X  Y) X (fun _ => Y) where
```

Or is it dFunLike? I still don't understand the naming convention...

```suggestion
instance dfunLike { : YoungDiagram} : DFunLike (Ssyt )  fun _     where
```
(or possibly dFunLike)

```suggestion
instance dfunLike : DFunLike ( i,  i)   :=
```
or dFunLike
Should this entire directory be renamed Mathlib/Data/DFunLike?
We're going to re-add `FunLike` in #8386 and pretend it's the main definition (or at least the one most users will care about), so I'd like to keep the current directory name.
Is the idea right now to still leave this stuff in the DFunLike namespace?

For now, yes. I would like to eventually have everything in the `FunLike` namespace (except perhaps anything specialized to the dependent case), but that would require something smarter than a find-and-replace everywhere.
Would we rather have FunLike.finite etc now?
Implemented in #9833.

```suggestion
injective coercion to (dependent) functions from `` to ``.
```
to give some hint about what the `D` means
Maybe `FunLike.fintype` is better than `DFunLike.fintype'`?
Good points! I'd like to do definition-by-definition renaming in a follow-up PR (or perhaps even a series), so we can address this with more care.
Implemented in #9833.

```suggestion
theorem FunLike.finite [Finite ] [Finite ] : Finite G :=
```
Implemented in #9833.
After changes in `simp` this porting note might be removable and the old proof might work again?
I'd like to try this in a follow-up PR.
(partially) implemented in #9834.

```suggestion
instance dfunLike : DFunLike (PolynomialModule R M)  fun _ => M :=
```
or dFunLike

```suggestion
instance dfunLike : DFunLike C^nI, M; I', M' M fun _ => M' where
```
or dFunLike

```suggestion
instance dFunLike {x : M} : DFunLike C^I, M; x M fun _ =>  :=
```
or dfunLike

```suggestion
instance dFunLike : DFunLike (FreeGroupBasis  G)  (fun _  G) where
```
or dfunLike?

```suggestion
instance AffineMap.dFunLike (k : Type*) {V1 : Type*} (P1 : Type*) {V2 : Type*} (P2 : Type*)
```

```suggestion
instance dFunLike : DFunLike (AffineBasis  k P)  fun _ => P where
```

```suggestion
instance dFunLike : DFunLike (M [^][R] N) (  M) (fun _ => N) where
```

```suggestion
instance dFunLike : DFunLike (Basis  R M)  fun _ => M where
```

```suggestion
-- TODO: instantiate `FunLike`
```
This one will be non-dependent, right?

```suggestion
instance instDFunLike : DFunLike (PerfectPairing R M N) M (fun _   N [R] R) where
```

```suggestion
instance dFunLike : DFunLike (QuadraticForm R M) M fun _ => R where
```
Or should this be a FunLike instance after all?
Are we OK with this change? I think everything here is non-dependent?

```suggestion
instance instDFunLike : DFunLike (AddChar R R') R fun _  R' :=
```
So we seem to be totally inconsistent about whether instance names are `instFunLike` or `funLike`.

```suggestion
instance MulChar.instDFunLike : DFunLike (MulChar R R') R (fun _ => R') :=
```
I'm finding all these instance name changes manually, maybe it's best to write code which fixes them all? I certainly could have missed some.

```lean
instance dFunLike : DFunLike (FreeGroupBasis  G)  (fun _  G) where
```

```suggestion
instance instDFunLike (X Y : BddLat) : DFunLike (X  Y) X (fun _ => Y) :=
```

```suggestion
instance instDFunLike (X Y : BddOrd) : DFunLike (X  Y) X (fun _ => Y) :=
```

```suggestion
instance instDFunLike (X Y : SemilatSupCat) : DFunLike (X  Y) X (fun _ => Y) :=
```

```suggestion
instance instDFunLike (X Y : SemilatInfCat) : DFunLike (X  Y) X (fun _ => Y) :=
```
Should this be dependent? Might be out of scope for this PR
I'd like to postpone this cleanup after the heavy changes of #8386 have passed.

```suggestion
instance Hom_DFunLike (X Y : MonCat) : DFunLike (X  Y) X (fun _ => Y) :=
```
This is used a couple of times, so it needs to be replaced also somewhere else.
Do you think that the preferred spelling will be `FunLike.coe` again one day? (also the change a few lines later)
I don't know: `coe` is a field of the `DFunLike` structure so it's not quite as easy to rename it as it would be for a plain definition.

```lean
instance instDFunLike (X Y : BddOrd) : DFunLike (X  Y) X (fun _ => Y) :=
```

```lean
instance instDFunLike (X Y : SemilatSupCat) : DFunLike (X  Y) X (fun _ => Y) :=
```

```lean
instance instDFunLike (X Y : SemilatInfCat) : DFunLike (X  Y) X (fun _ => Y) :=
```

```lean
instance dFunLike : DFunLike (PMF )  fun _ => 0 where
```

```lean
/-- Helper instance for when there's too many metavariables to apply `DFunLike.hasCoeToFun`
```

```suggestion
/- porting note: because of the `DFunLike` instance, we already have a coercion to `C(I, X)`
```

```suggestion
instance dFunLike : DFunLike (^ N X x) (I^N) fun _ => X where
```

nodes.body: Quick pass through visible changes in GH UI. Only some naming conventions.

I manually looked through the diff and didn't see any howlers. I guess the main thing I learnt is that we are very inconsistent with `instFunLike` v `funLike` for instance names. I guess the instance names might also all be changeable with `sed`.

I decided to rename all the `instance funLike` to `instance instDFunLike` to make the naming convention consistent all at once. If you disagree, it should be easy to revert and redo [e5798c5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9785/commits/e5798c5ab98a41ee8cdf6b2dba5267d4591b8a43).

I think this has had a thorough look-over. I am going to delegate it. 

If anyone has any more comments, please register them soon. 

bors-delegate+
